alert.note: Alert for Adair; Boyle; Casey; Clark; Garrard; Green; Lincoln; Madison; Marion; Russell; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 11:07AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lincoln, Garrard, southeastern Clark, central Green, southeastern Marion, northeastern Russell, Taylor, southern Boyle, Madison, Casey and northeastern Adair Counties through 1145 AM EDT/1045 AM CDT/... At 1107 AM EDT/1007 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lombard to 6 miles northeast of Liberty. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Russell County in south central Kentucky, southern Boyle County in east central Kentucky, southeastern Marion County in south central Kentucky, southeastern Clark County in east central Kentucky, Taylor and Lincoln Counties in south central Kentucky, Madison and Garrard Counties in east central Kentucky, Casey, northeastern Adair and central Green Counties in south central Kentucky, including the following locations... Boneyville, Parksville, Teddy, Broughtentown, Buggytown, Romine, Evans Ford, Acton, Cotton Branch and Trapp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Boyle; Casey; Clark; Garrard; Green; Lincoln; Madison; Marion; Russell; Taylor
